Summary: Basket → No option to decrease item quantity; user can only delete all items
Description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Open the Browse Sweets page.
# Add the same sweet multiple times (e.g., add “Chocolate Cups” three times).
# Go to the Basket page.
# Observe the available actions for managing quantities.

*Expected Results:*
The basket should allow users to modify the quantity of an item — including increasing or decreasing the number of units — without having to remove the item completely.

*Actual Results:*
The basket only provides a Delete Item option.
There is no option to reduce the quantity, forcing the user to delete the item entirely and re-add the desired quantity manually.

Summary: Billing and Payment → CVV field incorrectly displays increment and decrement arrows
Description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Open the Checkout page.
# Scroll down to the Payment section.
# Click on the CVV input field.
# Observe the presence of increment and decrement (up/down) arrows inside the field.

*Expected Results:*
The CVV field should be a plain numeric input box without any increment or decrement arrows.
Users should only be able to type digits manually, as CVV values are not meant to be adjusted using arrow controls.

*Actual Results:*
The CVV field displays increment and decrement arrows, allowing users to increase or decrease the value using the arrows, which is inappropriate for CVV input.

Summary: Basket and Shipping → Total price displays “NaN” when switching to Standard Shipping option
Description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*

# Open the Checkout page after adding any item(s) to the basket.
# Scroll to the Delivery section.
# Switch the delivery option from Collect (FREE) to Standard Shipping (£1.99).
# Observe the Total (GBP) field.

*Expected Results:*
The total price should update correctly to reflect the sum of the item(s) cost and the shipping fee (e.g., Item total + £1.99).

*Actual Results:*
When switching to Standard Shipping, the total displays as “£NaN” instead of the correct numeric value.

Summary: Billing and Payment → → System accepts numbers and special characters in the “Name on card” field
Description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Open the Billing and Payment page.
# Scroll to the Payment section.
# Click on the Name on card input field.
# Enter text containing numbers and symbols (e.g., “John123”, “John @Doe!”).
# Click Continue to checkout.

*Expected Results:*
The “Name on card” field should accept only alphabetic characters and spaces.
Any input containing numbers or special characters should trigger a validation error or prevent submission.

*Actual Results:*
The system accepts inputs with numbers and special characters in the “Name on card” field without any validation error.

Summary: Billing and Payment → Expiration date field lacks proper MM/YY format or input guidance
Description:
Steps to Reproduce:
Open the Billing and Payment page.
Scroll down to the Payment section.
Click on the Expiration field.
Observe how the system handles input entry.

Expected Results:
The expiration date field should guide or enforce the correct format (MM/YY).
Users should either see a placeholder (e.g., “MM/YY”) or have the slash (/) automatically inserted as they type.
Only valid month and year values should be accepted.

Actual Results:
The expiration date field provides no placeholder or automatic formatting.
Users must manually type the slash (/) and can enter values in an incorrect or unclear format, leading to potential input errors.

Summary: Billing and Payment -> System accepts invalid expiration date formats and expired dates in the payment section
Description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Open the Billing and payment page.
# Scroll to the Payment section.
# Leave the Expiration field empty and attempt to submit → observe the validation.
# Then, enter invalid data in the Expiration field, such as:
# Alphabetic characters (e.g., “AB/CD”)
# Special characters (e.g., “@@/##”)
# Invalid dates (e.g., “13/45”)
# Expired dates (e.g., “01/23”)
# Click Continue to checkout after each input.

*Expected Results:*
The system should prevent submission if the Expiration field is empty or invalid.
Only valid, non-expired dates in the MM/YY format should be accepted.

*Actual Results:*
The system correctly prevents submission when the field is left empty,
but it accepts invalid inputs, including alphabetic characters, special characters, expired dates, and non-existent dates.

Summary: Billing and Payment → System accepts letters and special characters in the card number field
Description:
Steps to Reproduce:
Open the Billing and Payment page.
Click on the Credit card number input field.
Enter alphabetic characters (e.g., “abcd”), or special characters (e.g., “@#$%”).
Attempt to proceed by clicking Continue to checkout.

Expected Results:
The system should only accept numeric input (0–9) in the card number field and reject letters or special characters.
It should also restrict the maximum input length to 19 digits.

Actual Results:
The system accepts alphabetic and special characters in the card number field, though it correctly restricts input length to a maximum of 19 digits.

Summary: Billing and payment -> system accepts trailing and leading space without omitting them
Description:
*Steps to Reproduce* 

# open billing and payment page 
# enter leading and trailing space in name fields 

*Expected Results* 

System automatically deletes trailing or leading space



*Actual Results* 

system accepts trailing and leading spaces

Summary: Billing and Payment -> system accepts more than 3 or 4 digits in CVV
Description:
*Steps to reproduce*
# open the billing and payment page 
# click on continue to check and observe fields 
# select CVV field and type more than 4 digits and observe the field changing from red to green

*Expected results*
system rejects more than 4 digits and the field turns red again, signaling invalid inputs

*Actual results*
system accepts more than 4 digits and the field stays green

Summary: Billing and Payment → Form fields clear and no action occurs after clicking “Continue to checkout”
Description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Open the Checkout page.
# Fill in all required fields in the Billing address and Payment sections (First name, Last name, Email, Address, Country, City, ZIP, Card details).
# Click the Continue to checkout button.

*Expected Results:*
The system should validate the entered information and proceed to the next step of the checkout process (e.g., order confirmation or payment processing).
All input data should remain intact unless a specific validation error occurs.

*Actual Results:*
After clicking Continue to checkout, no progress or confirmation occurs.
All entered data is cleared from the fields, forcing the user to re-enter their information.

Summary: Browse Sweets → No quantity selector available before adding items to the basket
Description:
Steps to Reproduce:
Open the Browse Sweets page.
Select any sweet (e.g., Chocolate Cups).
Observe the product card and “Add to Basket” button.
Try to select or input a quantity before clicking “Add to Basket.”

Expected Results:
Users should be able to select or input the number of items they wish to add (e.g., using a quantity field or dropdown) before adding to the basket.

Actual Results:
There is no option to specify quantity.
The user must repeatedly click “Add to Basket” to add multiple units of the same sweet.

Summary: Browse Sweets → Basket icon and top navigation bar not visible when scrolling down the page
Description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Open the Browse Sweets page.
# Scroll down until several product rows are visible.

*Expected Results:*
The top navigation bar (including Basket icon, Login, About, and Sweets links) should remain visible or fixed (sticky header) while scrolling, allowing easy access to navigation and cart actions.

*Actual Results:*
When scrolling down, the top menu and Basket icon disappear from view, requiring the user to scroll back to the top to access them.

Summary: Browse Sweets → Product prices are visually misaligned between sweet cards
Description:
*Steps to Reproduce*
# Open the Browse Sweets page.
# Observe the price text alignment across all product cards.

*Expected Results:*
All prices should be consistently aligned (vertically and horizontally) within each product card for a uniform appearance.

*Actual Results:*
Prices are visually misaligned between different product cards, causing uneven spacing and inconsistent UI layout.

Summary: Broken image -> displayed for “Wham Bars” product
Description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Open the Browse Sweets page.
# Scroll to locate the Wham Bars product card.

*Expected Results:*
The product image for Wham Bars should be displayed correctly, matching the other sweets on the page.

*Actual Results:*
A broken image icon is shown instead of the product image for Wham Bars, indicating a missing or invalid image source link.

Summary: Browse Sweets -> No feedback confirming addition to basket
Description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Open the Browse Sweets page.
# Select any sweet and click the Add to Basket button.

*Expected Results:*
After clicking Add to Basket, the system should provide visual or textual feedback (e.g., a confirmation message, animation, or basket count update) to indicate that the item was successfully added.

*Actual Results:*
No confirmation message, animation, or basket update is displayed after adding an item, leaving the user unsure whether the action succeeded.

Summary: Login Page → System accepts any password for any email address
Description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Open the Login page
# Enter any valid email address.
# Enter any random password.
# Click the Login button.


*Expected Results:*
The system should validate the entered credentials and only allow login with the correct email–password combination. Invalid credentials should trigger an error message.

*Actual Results:*
The system logs in successfully with any random password, without validating credentials against the user’s email.

Summary: Login Page → Tab navigation moves focus to logo hyperlink instead of Password field
Description:
*Steps to Reproduce:*
# Open the Login page.
# Click on the Email address input field.
# Enter any text in the email field.
# Press the Tab key to switch to the next input.

*Expected Results:*
Pressing Tab should move the cursor focus from the Email address field directly to the Password field.

*Actual Results:*
Pressing Tab shifts the focus to the website logo (home page hyperlink) instead of the Password field, interrupting the expected input flow.
